items.title: Trump announces 34% tariff on Chinese imports
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump announced a 34% tariff on Chinese imports starting April 5, 2023.
- The tariff increases from a 10% baseline to an additional 24% on April 9, 2023.
- An executive order was signed to end duty exemptions for low-value shipments from China effective May 2, 2023.
- China's embassy criticized the tariffs, stating that protectionism leads nowhere.
- The impact of these tariffs on US consumers and industries is under assessment, with concerns for US countries reliant on exports to China.

items.title: Adtech firm AppLovin in talks to acquire TikTok as US seeks buyer
items.summary:
- AppLovin is reportedly in talks to acquire TikTok, as sourced by CNBC.
- The Trump administration is looking for a US-based owner for TikTok, amidst a potential ban by April 5 due to national security concerns.
- The divestment deadline was extended from January 19 by 75 days, but it's uncertain if AppLovin will acquire TikTok’s non-Chinese operations.

items.title: US Tariffs Impact Southeast Asia with High Rates for Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos
items.summary:
- On Apr. 2, the US imposed tariffs of 10% to 49% on several Southeast Asian nations under the "Liberation Day" initiative.
- Cambodia, Laos, and Vietnam face the highest tariffs at 49%, 48%, and 46%, respectively.
- Other affected countries include Myanmar (44%), Thailand (36%), Indonesia (32%), Brunei (24%), Malaysia (24%), the Philippines (17%), Timor-Leste (10%), and Singapore (10%).
- The White House claims the tariffs address unfair trade practices, but critics argue they are based on trade surplus data.
- The tariffs may significantly impact economies reliant on exports, particularly Vietnam, which relies on US trade for 29% of total exports.
- Cambodia's garment industry, heavily reliant on the US, is expected to suffer.
- Analysts warn the move could weaken trust in US partnerships, especially with Vietnam amidst strengthening ties.

items.title: US tariffs on Vietnam could hit Nike, Adidas hard
items.summary:
- The US is considering tariffs on imports from Vietnam, targeting brands like Nike and Adidas.
- The decision is expected on April 2, aimed at boosting domestic production and addressing trade imbalances.
- Vietnam has a significant trade surplus with the US, amounting to $123.5 billion.
- Nike produces 50% of its footwear and 28% of its apparel in Vietnam, while Adidas sources 39% of its footwear and 18% of its apparel there.
- Smaller brands like On rely heavily on Vietnam, with 90% of shoes and 60% of apparel sourced there.
- Current US tariffs on Vietnamese footwear average 13.6% and 18.8% on apparel, with potential increases raising costs for brands.
- Nike is already experiencing market share losses and projected revenue declines, which could worsen with new tariffs.
- Production relocation is costly and complex, and other Southeast Asian countries may also face tariffs.
- Vietnamese leaders are working to mitigate impacts by increasing US imports and reducing duties.

items.title: Payoneer founder launches new startup in Israel for creators
items.summary:
- The founder of Payoneer has launched a new startup aimed at supporting creators in Israel.
- The startup focuses on providing financial and operational solutions for content creators.
- This initiative is part of a broader trend of supporting the growing creator economy.

items.title: Carsome partners with Google Cloud for AI, cloud upgrade
Ex-Google researcher joins AgiBot as chief scientist
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Luo Jianlan joins AgiBot as chief scientist to lead the Zhiyuan Embodied Intelligence Research Centre in Shanghai.
- AgiBot, founded in 2023 by Peng Zhihui, aims to enhance its AI and robotics capabilities under Luo’s direction.
- Luo has a PhD from UC Berkeley and has experience with Google X and DeepMind, focusing on machine learning and robotics.

items.title: Tesla faces decline in China sales as local competitors grow
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales in China are declining due to increasing competition from local brands.
- Local electric vehicle manufacturers are capturing significant market share.
- The market dynamics in China are shifting, impacting Tesla's growth strategy.
- Analysts suggest that Tesla needs to adapt its business model to remain competitive in the region.

items.title: BCG’s revenue hit $13.5b in 2024, driven by AI demand
items.summary:
- BCG reported a revenue of $13.5 billion in 2024.
- The increase in revenue is primarily driven by demand for AI services.
- Analysis highlights the growing importance of AI in consulting business models.

items.title: Foxconn boosts investments in India, Vietnam for AI servers
items.summary:
- Foxconn announces plans to increase investment in AI server production in India and Vietnam.
- The initiative is part of a broader strategy to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on China.
- The company's move reflects growing demand for AI infrastructure globally.

items.title: Israeli AI-powered voice firm Hi Auto raises $15m series A
items.summary:
- Hi Auto, an Israel-based AI voice technology startup, raised $15 million in Series A funding, totaling $23 million raised so far.
- The funding round was led by Delek Motors, the Zisapel Family, and Vasuki Tech Fund, with participation from other investors.
- The company aims to expand in the quick-service restaurant (QSR) sector and enhance its AI voice technology for drive-thru services.
- Hi Auto's SaaS platform automates drive-thru ordering with over 96% accuracy and 90% order completion, addressing labor cost and staffing challenges.

items.title: AI giants seek reduced regulation under Trump administration
items.summary:
- Executives from major AI companies, including OpenAI, Google, and Meta, are seeking reduced regulation under the Trump administration.
- President Trump, in office since January 2025, is focused on accelerating AI development and repealing Biden-era regulations aimed at privacy and transparency.
- AI companies, including OpenAI, are lobbying for favorable federal policies to prevent state-level regulations, citing competition from China's AI progress.
- Companies are also pushing for federal support to classify AI training on copyrighted materials as "fair use" amid ongoing lawsuits.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to assist founders in choosing the right venture capitalists (VCs).
- Founders can anonymously share reviews about VCs, addressing the common practice of discreet comments about investors.
- The initiative aims to provide candid feedback to VCs and empower entrepreneurs with information for better decision-making.

items.title: Tesla stock jumps 5% after Musk US gov’t exit rumor
items.summary:
- Tesla shares rose over 5% on Apr. 2 after speculation that Elon Musk may resign from the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- White House dismissed the report as "garbage," while Musk called it "fake" on X, despite the stock rebounding after a 6.4% initial drop due to weak Q1 delivery numbers.
- Report claims Musk and Trump agreed he would focus on his businesses, with Musk potentially leaving his government role after 130 days as a special employee.
- Tesla shares dropped over 31% this year, with a significant 36% decline in Q1, its worst since 2022.
- Musk's government position has reportedly triggered protests and boycotts, amid concerns about Trump’s auto tariffs affecting Tesla's suppliers.
- NYC Comptroller Brad Lander has urged legal action for alleged misrepresentation of Musk’s involvement affecting NYC pension funds.
- Musk faces scrutiny for political activities, including a rally for a Republican candidate, raising concerns about the impact on Tesla's interests.

items.title: Chinese tech giants bought $16b in Nvidia H20 chips in Q1 2025
items.summary:
- ByteDance, Alibaba, and Tencent ordered over $16 billion worth of Nvidia H20 chips in Q1 2025.
- The H20 is Nvidia’s most advanced AI chip available in China under US export restrictions tightened in October 2023.
- The startup DeepSeek has increased demand for H20 by using it for cost-effective AI models despite US limits on Nvidia’s top chips.
- Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expects minimal short-term impact from restrictions and plans to shift production to the US.

items.title: Trump-linked Truth Social operator plans $2.3b stock sale
items.summary:
- Trump Media & Technology Group filed documents with the US SEC for a potential US$2.3 billion stock sale.
- The company operates Truth Social, a social media platform associated with President Donald Trump.
- Following the filing, shares of Trump Media dropped approximately 7% in premarket trading on April 2.

items.title: Automattic lays off 280 employees amid legal challenges
items.author: Matt Mullenweg
items.summary:
- Automattic laid off about 280 employees, reducing its workforce by 16% from 1,777 to 1,495.
- CEO Matt Mullenweg stated layoffs were essential for the company's long-term future.
- Automattic is involved in a legal dispute with WP Engine, which could have serious financial implications.

items.title: SG now has 49 billionaires, up from 39 in 2024: Forbes
items.summary:
- Singapore now has 49 billionaires, an increase from 39 in 2024, with a combined wealth of US$145.2 billion.
- Goh Cheng Liang is the richest person in Singapore with a net worth of US$13 billion, ranking 182nd globally.
- New billionaires include Quek Leng Chye and Lim Kaling, with notable figures like Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and Jeff Bezos topping the global list.

items.title: Tech stocks drop after Trump’s new tariffs announcement
items.summary:
- Tech stocks declined on Apr. 2 following Trump's announcement of new tariffs on imports.
- New tariffs range from 10% to 49%, with Apple leading the drop at over 6% losses.
- Nvidia, Tesla, Alphabet, Amazon, and Meta also experienced losses between 2.5% and 5%.
- Specific tariffs include 10% on all imports, 34% on China, 20% on Europe, and 24% on Japan.
- The S&P 500 ETF dropped 2.8%, and the Nasdaq 100 ETF fell over 3% amid negative market sentiment.
- The Nasdaq faced its worst quarter since 2022, down 10% in Q1 2023.

items.title: Google’s Gemini AI leader Sissie Hsiao steps down
items.summary:
- Sissie Hsiao has stepped down from leading Google's AI chatbot, Bard, now known as Gemini.
- Josh Woodward, head of Google Labs, will take over her responsibilities while keeping his current role.
- Hsiao plans to take a short break before returning to Google in a new capacity.
- Demis Hassabis, CEO of Google DeepMind, stated the leadership change aims to support the evolution of the Gemini app.
- Last year, Google's Gemini team was moved to DeepMind to streamline its generative AI operations.

items.title: AI insurance platform FurtherAI bags $5m seed funding
items.summary:
- FurtherAI has secured US$5 million in seed funding led by Nexus Venture Partners.
- The funding will be used to expand its AI team, enhance products, and strengthen commercial insurance presence.
- FurtherAI plans to enter the UK market amidst rising AI adoption in insurance.
- The company automates underwriting, compliance, and claims processing with 95%-97% accuracy, surpassing manual processing.
- Insurers managing over US$15 billion in premiums utilize FurtherAI to improve efficiency and underwriter productivity.
- The investment underscores interest in AI solutions addressing traditional industry inefficiencies like rising expenses and talent shortages.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: AI shift triggers layoffs at Zomato
items.summary:
- Zomato is experiencing layoffs due to an increased shift towards AI technologies.
- The company is restructuring its workforce in response to market demands and operational efficiencies.
- The impact of AI on employment is a growing concern across the industry.
- This change reflects broader trends in the tech sector regarding automation and workforce realignment.
- The article provides a detailed overview of the ongoing layoffs in Asia related to AI advancements.

items.title: Amazon reportedly makes last-minute bid to acquire TikTok
items.summary:
- Amazon has made a last-minute bid to acquire TikTok ahead of the Apr. 5 divestment deadline for ByteDance.
- The bid was communicated in a letter to Vice President JD Vance and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, although its seriousness is disputed.
- Following the news, Amazon’s shares increased by 1.3%.
- The divestment deadline is due to a national security law regarding ByteDance's ownership.
- An executive order by President Trump delayed enforcement of the law by 75 days.
- Interest in acquiring TikTok has been expressed by multiple parties, as the platform is used by nearly half of Americans.

items.title: Tesla Q1 deliveries fall 13%, miss investor estimates
items.summary:
- Tesla delivered 336,000 vehicles in Q1 2025, a 13% drop from 2024 and below investor expectations of 360,000–370,000.
- Production reached 345,454 units, mainly from Model 3 and Model Y with 323,800 deliveries.
- Factory shutdowns for Model Y upgrades contributed to the decline despite CEO Elon Musk's optimism.
- Tesla’s market share fell notably in Europe (9.3% from 17.9%), Germany (4% from 16%), and a significant drop in China.
- Tesla’s stock fell 36% in Q1, erasing $460 billion in market value due to brand struggles and increasing competition.

items.title: Southeast Asia tech ecosystem report
items.summary:
- The report covers the evolution of Southeast Asia’s startup ecosystem.
- Highlights include the diverse range of industries, with ecommerce and fintech as the dominant sectors.
- The report emphasizes the importance of tracking emerging startups and recent funding deals in the region.

items.title: Meta under US Senate review for alleged China market efforts
items.summary:
- A US Senate subcommittee is reviewing Meta's attempts to access the Chinese market.
- Senators request documentation from CEO Mark Zuckerberg by April 21, including internal communications since 2014.
- Allegations arise from former employee Sarah Wynn-Williams' book claiming a project called 'Project Aldrin' was developed in 2014 to enter China.
- Meta denies allegations, stating operations in China were abandoned in 2019.
- Subcommittee also seeks documents related to Meta’s Chinese partners, content censorship, and a canceled telecommunications cable project.

items.title: TikTok to shut down its photo-sharing app in May 2025
items.summary:
- TikTok will shut down its photo-sharing platform, TikTok Notes, on May 8, 2025.
- The app was launched in 2024 and faced challenges in user adoption.
- Users are encouraged to migrate to Lemon8, another app owned by ByteDance, which has about 12.5 million monthly active users as of December 2024.
- TikTok will use feedback from TikTok Notes to enhance Lemon8.
- The shutdown comes as TikTok navigates uncertainties regarding its operations in the US due to a looming ban deadline on April 5, 2025.

items.title: A16z said to consider TikTok investment as part of Oracle-led bid
items.summary:
- A16z is reportedly considering an investment in TikTok.
- This potential investment is part of a broader Oracle-led bid.
- The news indicates increasing interest in TikTok despite regulatory concerns.

items.title: The 3-minute shows making billions
items.summary:
- Microdramas, short vertical videos, are rapidly growing in popularity and revenue in China, even surpassing box office films in earnings.
- The format's success lies in its convenience with short episodes featuring engaging cliffhangers.
- Southeast Asian companies are beginning to produce original microdramas, but may face tough competition from established Chinese producers.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Singapore
items.summary:
- The article lists the top 50 startups and tech companies in Singapore based on their funding raised in the past two years.
- It utilizes data from Tech in Asia to highlight the financial success of these companies.
- Access to the full article requires a subscription, as this is premium content.

items.title: AC Ventures sells 6.5% of GCash to Mitsubishi for $321.5m
items.summary:
- The Philippines’ Ayala Corp. sold 6.5% of GCash to Japan’s Mitsubishi Corp for 18.4 billion pesos (around US$321.5 million).
- AC Ventures holds a 13% stake in Mynt, which operates GCash.
- Mitsubishi also acquires 18 million common and redeemable preferred shares of AC Ventures.
- Post-transaction, Ayala and Mitsubishi will each own 50% of AC Ventures.

items.title: China launches plan to boost financial services for tech firms
items.summary:
- China has announced a new plan to enhance financial services for technology-driven enterprises.
- The initiative integrates advancements in technology and industry to improve financial support mechanisms.
- It aims to create a multi-level technology financial service ecosystem involving various stakeholders.
- The plan focuses on enhancing credit and insurance services for tech firms and promoting bond financing.
- Financial institutions are encouraged to adopt technologies like cloud computing and AI for better risk management.
- Differentiated evaluation systems will be introduced to improve financing guarantees for tech businesses.

items.title: UK authors push for action against Meta over AI copyright use
items.author: Richard Osman, Kazuo Ishiguro
items.summary:
- A group of authors, including Richard Osman and Kazuo Ishiguro, are pushing the UK government to hold Meta accountable for alleged copyright infringements.
- The Society of Authors has organized an open letter published as a petition on Change.org, urging Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy to summon Meta executives.
- The authors allege Meta used works from LibGen, a shadow library, without permission, claiming it could severely impact UK writers.
- Meta has denied the allegations, stating that its AI models operate under fair use of copyrighted material.

items.title: OpenAI faces $10b funding cut unless it goes for-profit
items.summary:
- OpenAI's private funding round, currently valued at $40 billion, may drop by $10 billion unless it converts to a for-profit entity by December 31.
- SoftBank's investment would decrease from $30 billion to $20 billion; Microsoft and others expected to maintain $10 billion commitments.
- OpenAI's valuation could reach $300 billion with incoming capital; restructuring needs approval from Microsoft and California Attorney General.
- Legal challenges add complexity, including a case from co-founder Elon Musk.
- Financing includes convertible notes turning into equity post-restructuring; part will fund Stargate venture with SoftBank and Oracle.
- CEO Sam Altman focuses on research while COO Brad Lightcap expands business operations; revenue projected to triple to $12.7 billion by 2025.

items.title: Tesla’s stock falls 36% as Musk’s political role affects sales
items.summary:
- Tesla’s stock dropped 36% in Q1 2025, losing over $460 billion in market capitalization.
- The decline is linked to CEO Elon Musk’s role in Trump’s second administration, leading the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), causing protests and boycotts against Tesla.
- Tesla faces challenges with declining vehicle sales and skepticism about Musk’s promised driverless ride-hailing service by June in Austin, Texas.
- Analysts express doubt regarding Tesla's ability to fulfill deadlines for Full Self-Driving software and hardware upgrades.
- Musk describes the situation as a “buying opportunity” for investors.

items.title: Amazon resumes Prime Air drone deliveries after 2-month pause
items.summary:
- Amazon has restarted Prime Air drone deliveries in Texas and Arizona after a two-month suspension.
- Deliveries were halted due to altitude sensor issues caused by dust; no safety incidents reported.
- A software update has been approved by the FAA to resume operations.
- The MK30 drone model, designed to be quieter and capable of flying in light rain, is being used.
- Noise complaints have led to plans to relocate the drone hub in College Station.
- Amazon aims to deliver 500 million packages by drone annually by 2030 despite challenges faced in drone development.

items.title: US court allows most of New York Times’ AI lawsuit to proceed
items.summary:
- A US District Court judge allows most of the New York Times’ lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft to proceed.
- The lawsuit, filed in late 2023, claims copyright infringement for using Times’ content to train AI models.
- Judge Sidney Stein rejected motions to dismiss related to indirect liability and older copyrighted works, but partially dismissed claims on copyright management information.
- The case represents a significant legal challenge by a news publisher against AI companies, with other publishers joining the lawsuit.
- The ruling occurs amid debates on whether AI's use of publicly available data qualifies as "fair use"; a court decision on a jury trial will follow discovery.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Singapore
items.summary:
- The article lists startups in Singapore that have recently raised funding, indicating potential for growth.
- The list is continually updated and includes companies up to Series E stage.
- Each entry features key details about the respective funding rounds.

items.title: US clothing startup CaaStle faces collapse after fraud allegations
items.summary:
- CaaStle, a US clothing startup, is facing potential collapse due to fraud allegations.
- These allegations could jeopardize the business model that CaaStle relies on.
- The company has not provided a public statement addressing the issue directly.

items.title: Australian retail tech startup Flagship nets $3.75m seed funding
items.summary:
- Australian startup Flagship raises $3.75 million in seed funding.
- The funding will support the development of its retail technology solutions.
- Investors include leading venture capital firms and angel investors.
- Flagship aims to enhance the shopping experience for customers through innovative tech.

items.title: ByteDance founder denies acquiring Singapore citizenship
items.summary:
- ByteDance’s founder Zhang Yiming denied reports of obtaining Singaporean citizenship.
- The claim emerged from a report published on Apr. 1 by Singapore’s Lianhe Zaobao, but was retracted by Apr. 2.
- Citizenship acquisition would require renouncing Chinese citizenship under China’s nationality law.
- Zhang maintains a significant role at ByteDance despite stepping back from corporate duties and is known to spend considerable time in Singapore.

items.title: Asia prepares for Trump’s ‘Liberation Day’ tariffs
items.summary:
- President Trump will announce new tariffs on April 2 at 4 pm ET in the White House Rose Garden, termed "Liberation Day."
- Aimed at addressing perceived unfair trade practices, Asian countries like Vietnam, India, and Japan are bracing for economic fallout.
- Vietnam plans to reduce import duties on cars and food, while India considers tax cuts on agricultural products.
- Trump has previously imposed tariffs on Chinese goods, steel, aluminum, and auto imports.
- Specifics of the tariffs are unclear, but Trump hinted they might target "all countries."
- US allies like Japan and South Korea are preparing to support their industries; Japan's automaking sector is notably at risk.
- Asian companies are increasing US investments to reduce risks, including Honda’s $300 million investment in Ohio and TSMC’s $100 billion expansion.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet buys 160 BTC, now holds 4,206 BTC
items.summary:
- Japanese investment firm Metaplanet purchased 160 BTC for approximately US$13.3 million.
- The acquisition raised its total holdings to 4,206 BTC, valued at around US$356.2 million.
- Metaplanet has invested a total of US$359.8 million in bitcoin since starting its accumulation strategy in April 2024.
- The firm aims to hold 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 and 21,000 BTC by the end of 2026.
- Despite the announcement, Metaplanet’s stock fell by 0.98%, while bitcoin's price rose by 1.6% to US$84,526.

items.title: US video game retailer GameStop raises $1.5b to buy BTC
items.summary:
- GameStop has raised $1.5 billion through a private offering of 0.00% convertible senior notes due in 2030, including an additional $200 million in notes.
- The funds will be used to purchase bitcoin, following a strategy similar to MicroStrategy’s.
- Initially boosted GameStop’s stock, but shares have since declined, indicating mixed investor reactions.
- The company currently holds over $4 billion in cash and reported $3.8 billion in revenue in 2024, supporting further bitcoin acquisitions according to Nathan Cox, chief investment officer of Two Prime Digital Assets.
- Recent developments include a jump of 12% in stock on March 27, 2025, following bitcoin investment, despite a 30% drop in sales.

items.title: Circle paid $210m to acquire Coinbase’s stake, IPO filing reveals
items.summary:
- Circle purchased Coinbase's 50% stake in Centre Consortium for $210 million in shares in 2023, becoming the sole issuer of the USDC stablecoin.
- The acquisition involved about 8.4 million common shares of Circle, worth approximately $209.9 million.
- Following the acquisition, Centre Consortium was made an indirect subsidiary of Circle and was dissolved in December 2023, with its net assets transferred to another Circle subsidiary.

items.title: Indian startup funding up 41% to $3.1b in Q1 2025
items.summary:
- Indian startups raised US$3.1 billion across 232 deals in Q1 2025, a 41% increase from Q1 2024.
- Seed-stage startups secured US$188 million in 104 deals, an 18% rise year-on-year.
- Late-stage startups saw nearly 80% growth, with over US$1.8 billion raised in 38 deals.
- Key late-stage funding included Innovaccer’s US$275 million, Zolve’s US$251 million, and DarwinBox’s US$140 million.
- Growth-stage startups raised US$1 billion across 68 deals, up 7% year-on-year.
- Fintech led funding with US$739 million, followed by ecommerce at US$610 million and enterprise tech at US$458 million.
- M&A activity rose 73% year-on-year with 26 deals, notable ones including Hindustan Unilever’s acquisition of Minimalist.

items.title: Coinbase shares drop 30% due to US economic concerns
items.summary:
- Coinbase's stock has dropped over 30%, its worst performance since the FTX collapse in late 2022.
- Economic uncertainty, including recession fears and trade tensions, is driving market unease.
- The S&P 500 Index is on track for its worst quarter since mid-2022, prompting traders to move away from riskier assets like cryptocurrencies.
- Oppenheimer analyst Owen Lau cites macroeconomic factors as reasons for the decline in crypto stocks, which are more volatile than Bitcoin.

items.title: Tether acquires 8,888 bitcoins, raising holdings to $7.8b
items.summary:
- Tether acquired 8,888 bitcoin for US$735 million in Q1 2025, increasing total holdings to 92,646 BTC valued at about US$7.8 billion.
- The company has been accumulating bitcoin since September 2022, allocating 15% of quarterly net profits for this purpose.
- Despite a nearly 12% drop in bitcoin prices in Q1 2025, Tether's unrealized gains on its reserves amount to approximately US$3.86 billion.

items.title: China’s Guangdong province launches AI, robotics hub
items.summary:
- On Apr. 1, Guangdong provincial government launched an initiative for an AI and robotics hub.
- The plan includes subsidies of up to 50 million yuan (US$6.88 million) for manufacturing innovation hubs.
- Individual companies can receive up to 3 million yuan (US$412,662).
- Up to five open-source communities and ten large language model use cases will receive annual funding of up to 8 million yuan (US$1.1 million).
- Local tech firms like Huawei and Tencent are contributing to the initiative.
- This initiative aims to position Guangdong as a global leader in AI and robotics, following similar successes in other provinces like Zhejiang.

items.title: 9gag co-founder leads Asia’s first public virtual asset hub
items.author: Ray Chan
items.summary:
- Ray Chan, co-founder of 9gag, acquires a controlling stake in Howking Technology International Holdings Limited.
- The company will be renamed MemeStrategy Inc. pending shareholder approval.
- Chan to serve as chairman and CEO, with board members from 9gag and Memeland.
- MemeStrategy plans to integrate bitcoin and other virtual assets and invest in Web3 and AI.
- Will leverage 9gag’s community of over 200 million users for growth.
- Initiatives include “Creator Economy 4.0” and the “Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network” (DePin).
- Aims to establish itself as Asia’s first publicly listed virtual asset ecosystem and contribute to Hong Kong’s virtual assets hub.
